task: Explain a complex scientific concept in simple terms

test_cases.expected_behavior: Should explain quantum entanglement using simple language, analogies, and avoid technical jargon
validation_criteria: Includes at least one analogy or metaphor

test_cases.expected_behavior: Should explain photosynthesis in terms a middle-schooler could understand
validation_criteria: Uses everyday language and relatable examples
Explains the basic process (light + CO2 + water â†’ glucose + oxygen)
Explains technical terms if used (chlorophyll, glucose, etc.)

test_cases.expected_behavior: Should explain black holes and event horizons without requiring physics background
validation_criteria: Explains what a black hole is in simple terms
Clarifies what an event horizon means

test_cases.expected_behavior: Should explain DNA structure and function using accessible comparisons
validation_criteria: Explains DNA structure simply (double helix, base pairs)
Uses analogies (e.g., instruction manual, recipe, code)
Explains how information is stored and read
Avoids or explains technical terms (nucleotides, amino acids, etc.)
